D80v0A6hkbJUmU-dDVnXNA.text: We had great service ! Our waiter Luis was helpful and friendly ! The food was really excellent,we will definitely be back

photos.caption: Photo of Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xdLKrDh4eZsVyuLlto3OvQ.text: One of my all time favorite restaurants. Love their chips/salsa and guacamole. I'm addicted to their spicy preparadas with a Corona. The fideo soup is delicious and you must try the jalapeno cilantro margarita if you want a refreshing margarita with a spicy twist. My 2 fave main dishes are the sopa 7 mares and shrimp serandeada. Both unbelievably amazing! We've been going here for years and have never been disappointed. From the food, service and atmosphere...it is by far the best Mexican restaurant in town.

CC3PuwlnjtGo9XxXPNwKyw.text: Unfortunately I didn't even get to the food part of dining in this establishment. I walked in at 1:30pm to a place that was not even full by any means and with no line whatsoever. I requested a booth for a party of 2 and there was clearly at least one available booth right next to the hostess stand and she flat out refused to seat me there. Her claim, that booths were reserved for larger parties.   1. I saw booths only occuppied by two people.   2. There were zero parties waiting for a table.  When a restaurant does not appreciate your choice to spend your dollars there given an entire city of options, that in itself is clear to me that they don't ever care if I return again. So there you have it - I will never again return to this restaurant to spend my dollars when there is simply no regard for or appreciation of it. You can remind your hostess that we, as customers, are in fact the ones who keep her employed by spending our money there.  Remember that.

stvDUDVz0UcPQ413HeOiPQ.text: the love and I stopped in for quick lunch.  We got the chorizo sopes and shredded beef burrito. Burrito was delicious, beef was juicy and great size. Came with rice and beans which were also great. Chorizo sopes were good and flavorful but way to much lettuce.  We also got a jumbo Cadillac daddy on the rocks and strawberry blended margarita both were delicious.  Will be back again.

_M4Ifsw-fP4zxtSUpsc83w.text: I like the food it was very fresh and authentic the atmosphere and the people were very nice i recommended it it was a very nice experience if you like mexican come here.

a63FxjfMOlSoDUCmPnqRVQ.text: You guys want fajitas?  Go here. They got the memo that Mexican food should be in a heaping pile in front of mah face. Huge portions.  Plussss let's talk about the complimentary refried beans, salsa and chips. What?!  This fat white girl was amazed.  I'll be back. You bet your bottom dolar

VHqYO0bJpy2zI_uKpDD7hQ.text: So good! Steak fajitas for two! Stuffed with leftovers. Service was great. Busy but seated in less than 10 minutes. We will return!

Y-4avekUdLQmVeBw-5FLSQ.text: We were in town for a conference and wanted to stay away from the chaos of the strip. A google search found this place so we went. The service was excellent, the food was delicious and the folks around us were mostly families and they were having a great time. Being from Colorado I know good Mexican food and this was a hit with my group of 4. My only complaint is that this place isn't closer to home.

zK8ywewQFWeCJUDNxVWR2Q.text: Good, consistent food. The drinks are great. I'm seated within 10 minutes every time I visit and the staff is friendly. They serve you delicious chips, beans, and salsa when you're seated.  I'm partial to the tamales!

lHQH5N5jL89AUElcjyrJxA.text: To enjoy a nice home made meal, you must visit this place.. The Caldo was Hell of good, the chips came with home made frijoles and Salsa.. Really good Beans and the Best Part was that they are free. The restaurant was nice, big and Clean..

photos.caption: Photo of Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best Churros in Town!! Nice and Sweet!!
Photo of Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hand Home Made Tortllas! Mexican Style!!
Photo of Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caldo De Res!! Da Bomb!! and some hot &#34;Chiles&#34; Nice to cure the hang over!

V3YlvVwDkbGNwGv34VmtxQ.text: First visit here because one of the other Mexican food spots was closed for the Superbowl. Parking was easy, the interior and the culture of the inside is so beautiful, staff and faculty are quite accommodating, but the prices for the quality of food was not up to par. Because of the buffet special our wee party of three opted for the Sunday Brunch Buffet for $15.95 per adult.  Quality of food was not as warm as we'd hoped, the flour tortillas were burned, and a lot of the food served was pretty dry. Unfortunately, I am not a fan of low quality food, therefore the low quality rating.

2BOvlVQ9YTBkbifvCbV0PA.text: Food has no flavor and bartender gave me a sugar laced margarita even though I ordered a skinny one.   The lack of flavor is disappointing and I would have actually would have headed to Del Taco or Taco Bell.   Wouldn't waste your time or money at this place.

Zhx5u5TgzgWmT8AOi84CIA.text: Wow - they fit in our party for 8 with less than an hour reservation this evening for our friend's birthday.  The patio was lovely - service terrific - food very good.  And... no hassle over splitting the check - they figured out which was each couple - presented a check to each very smoothly.  We did miss our friend's shot of tequila! Other than that -was great!!

NFUs_TPtDljnmPoqF_g_nA.text: We checked  this place out a few times I think the pricing is fair the restaurants vibe is really nice service was always good  the food was good. My husband loves it , I think it's a good place food didn't send me over the moon or anything but definitely get a full meal for a decent price. I did really like the ice cream dessert.

kGihjZV_yRVfajIPJ3CphQ.text: Been wanting to come here for a months with my friend visiting from Chicago! I was soooooo disappointed the service was horrendous and the street tacos came with just bare meat no sauces. After I ate them being 9 months pregnant and not satisfied! I ordered more which came with sauces and sides. How confusing the waitress acted like it was not a big deal but it was u came over and saw our taco bare n yet said nothing !! My experience was ruined n after the fact! They gave me a whooping 1 dollar off how lame !!  I will come never back here $40 wasted jezzy! Managers saw the situation n gave no fucks !!!

fRzP0QMuIE5WbyMZFf51PA.text: Good spot close to home. Food is authentic lots of flavor with home made tortillas flour or corn. I have had several dishes here over the years I have not ever been disappointed yet.

lVJkCK99FG8-HB1NDulK0g.text: Most disappointing meal ever! Asada burrito and wow was i upset. I took to bits and the meat wasn't even chopped up properly, meat was too red for me, waiter never ask how was everything. When I pushed the plate on the side to show the waiter I didn't like the plate he just walked past it and the buster picked up my plate before explaining to the waiter how disappointed I was. Haven't came to this restaurant in a while and was excited but now I can see why I don't come here regularly.

EkHgMbLzvoAhetUekv39lQ.text: Always want good Mexican food in Vegas and this hit the spot. A soup and 3 piece combo (Chile rellano, enchilada and taco) were very satisfying. Chips and salsa was a great start, very fresh.  Added surprise was bean dip.

-5b_gGu9AkHOZ1B17sbGEA.text: I'm so upset with this restaurant I came home from work and wanted to enjoy some Mexican food I should of ordered at my usual Mexican restaurant but sad to say I didn't I was on the phone for over 20 min  because they had to go from one waitress to another finally I got my order done right so we hung up then 30 seconds later I realize that I had to change one of my combo plates so they answered I told them what I wanted they put me on hold then the manager got on the phone saying that the girls are confused so I told him and he told me that I had to pay for the order I already did and he will just add the additional plate to that because they already made that ( so naturally I flipped) and told him I just made the order 30 seconds ago there's no way you made the food I ordered and you won't Believe this but he's response was and remember he's the manager ( oh I thought you already picked up the food) definitely poor  Management so you know I told them forget it. bottom line is when you find a great place to eat just go to call it in and enjoy your dinner with your family.

oUkSEzhGxBTEf2xOX2PYKA.text: I had cheese enchiladas. They were sufficient, but not truly tasty. My husband's drink had some weird stuff inside the glass that looked and felt like refried beans but they said was horchata. There was no credit given, so no tip left. They have good ratings elsewhere, but this is not for me.

VtfiA2AApbkWDW1QzGlgYA.text: I truly like this place. I thought it would be typical Americanized Mexican cuisine and it stays True to form. I'm a foodie who loves to cook and make my own tamales, sauces and plates yet I always enjoy myself here and bring my company to partake.

photos.caption: Photo of Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This was a great meal where one can sub the rice/beans for grilled veggies and the flavor is great.

jUTak9DF5t-sG3PGmxFkrA.text: We came here for a wedding after party, the service was beyond amazing! The owner personally came out to check on our party and make sure everything was to everyone's satisfaction, we even let them know that not our full party was going to be able to attend and they said it was no problem the patio was ours, they went above and beyond everyones expectations! Food was amazing and portions were OMG!! Free refills on horchata, what?!?!?! Amazing! Bean dip with the chips and salsa, yea buddy!!!! Yummmmmmmy!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is like their super burrito! When they say grande, they mean grande!!

0qvj9hlIoUA55sdCXkEKTw.text: My second time here and with the same gaggle o'boys! And I would happily return.   The service here is AMAZING!! The entire staff is so attentive, and enjoyable!  The staff really makes this place above average! The outdoor patio is awesome!  The first time I was here was during the day, and I have to say oddly enough the food was actually much better. Maybe the day chef is more experienced? Or it was slower? Not sure, but we were all in agreement that.  The second time we went was for dinner, and it was busy! The food was still great, but not as perfect as the first time. Everyones dinner was a bit off. Meat cooked a tiny bit too long, some things hot, others only warm. And the $14 drinks was a bit of a shocker! Over all we had a great time.  Taking into account the pros and cons, I would go back.

ii8ebKB26eqBVXenTOfYow.text: Worst experience ever!! Had Mother's Day reservations. Food was horrible and waited for over 40min for the food. Service was extremely slow.... and the restaurant  was not even busy, but kept make Mother's Day as a excuse for the service. NEVER AGAIN and this wasn't the first time. 1 Star is to much.

iAzJ68rLpymnqCocpxg_uA.text: The food is fantastic. The servers are very nice here. If u want tequila, ask for Mark the owner. He knows his stuff

photos.caption: Photo of Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Anejo flight

UV1aHA1JQCm79J4lIV7AhQ.text: Went here for the Cinco de Mayo celebration.. I almost turned around and went home because I couldn't find a parking spot..then in the very far last row waaaaayyyyy far away opens up a spot. No big deal, it's a special event.. The restaurant is sort of small, but there's also outdoor seating on the side. Check out the window into the kitchen for a peek at tortillas in the making, it's a cool feature.. For the special event there were a bunch of tables set up outside in front of the restaurant with a stage for a mariachi band and a raffle. The tent outside had very limited drink selections - beer and plain margaritas.  I opted to go inside and hit up the full service bar. There was a gal bartender that made an amazing raspberry margarita. $17 for a small margarita and a shot of Don Julio... Back outside, we started getting hungry.. Unfortunately there was no food service outside. I appreciate the whole setup, but you shouldn't have a courtyard full of drinking patrons and not allow some kind of snacks..at least some chips and salsa!  I prefer the Lindo in Summerlin South.. It's larger and seems a tad nicer.

Zntconx7hCw0bol71gXKdg.text: We come to Michoacan frequently.  The service is always solid - every server is always very polite.  Their menu is extensive - they have a pretty wide range of items.  My husband loves their seafood soup.  I usually stick with my Mexican food standby of enchiladas.  Am giving them a 4 because Their enchilada sauce (red sauce) could use some more spunk.  It's not super flavorful.  We love the cups of Fideo soup they give with each meal.  It's such a simple soup, but we think it's nutritious.  The chips, salsa & bean dip is good.  We also like how the place is decorated.

photos.caption: Photo of Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bar
Photo of Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Restaurant
Photo of Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bar

FkJlilPVCi37ojBJfvaruw.text: Food is spectacular and the service and atmosphere are very welcoming.  It would have gotten a 5 from us, but it is a little on the pricey side.  Great for a nice night out. Muy bien!

W8pcaP8Rk1HxxZeiybfEyQ.text: I have been here numerous times. The guacamole is amazing. The margaritas are on point. Mark, the owner, is a great guy. The tortillas are homemade. They have events which are always a lot of fun with bands, tequila tasting and more. All of the servers and bartenders are nice and friendly. They bought out from Lindo because Lindo sucks. They continue to have my business.

lgHpdHfwgdqC_tAF_YjzMA.text: I have been seeing ads for this place for a long time. So I decided to finally come in. So disappointed!!! Leticia's Mexican Cocina is SO MUCH BETTER!!! The sauce for the chips and salsa that they offer complimentary taste like canned tomato sauce with a jalapeno chopped into it. Disgusting! The chimichanga was so dry. This is the kind of restaurant that makes me realize the importance of cooking at home. The only authentic Mexican print of this place is the music. Save yourself $60 and go elsewhere!!!

rEuqg5sJ05BVtysQnuLz2Q.text: This place is awesome, the food was fantastic. I ordered the reno and cheese enchilada. Joaquin our servicer was superb.

FcXdKdCTwuXpwM-25tKx6w.text: Love this place for Mexican food, the food is very good and authentic.  They bring the best bean dip and salsa for the homemade chips, good stuff, right there!  The service was superior and the staff friendly and welcoming. The manager came around to ask how our meal was and checked on us a couple times.  The fajitas were tender and marinated just right.  The chimichanga was crunchy and very tasty, reminiscent of True Mexico.  I tried both the location in Henderson, that location has a spectacular view of the entire valley, would love to go back at night.  Also the Centennial location, a bit smaller but the food and decor was just a nice.  I'll add this place to my list of favorite Mexican places.  Ole!!!

oCP8C3CEo1MCHJwCxOnXOw.text: If you need a party or big event catered I highly recommend Michoacan Restaurant. The food was absolutely delicious it arrived hot and right on time and there was so much of it!  From the first phone call I was put at ease and was not disappointed.  We had the fajitas and everything came with it the beans and rice and guacamole all of it was fresh and good. We Thank You Michoacan for making our party a success!!!

yxqPI85AMpQ3COk0fNHYCA.text: The manager was extremely nice and welcoming. As we were leaving he asked us how we liked the food which is rare to hear. The food was good and the prices reasonable.  If you're craving mexican food then this place will definitely satisfy you.  The authenticity is close, but of course,  not quite there.  The tortillas are handmade however and delicious. The only downsides,  in my opinion,  are the small wait area and the waiter never refilling my water,  which is a must when you have spicy salsa on the table.  Other than that, I left the establishment with a smile.  We will definitely be back.

kubGdckFOQlfhQja63dxYw.text: Good green chile chicken enchiladas!! They forgot to bring me my Fideo with my meal but not a big deal. Good chips and salsa. Great atmosphere. Will definitely be back.

tj-rAIbthHQUD4ZLSlnb-Q.text: Great food. Love having the waiter make the guacamole at the table. The portions are very large and could be split. I would definitely go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lAw7TgQrqiY6y0x46LxnzA.text: Me and my girlfriend loved coming to this place because of the amazing food the abundance of appetizers they give you and the bottomless mimosa margarita and bloody Mary's (only Sunday) which we would tell all of our friends and coworkers about!,we went today and were told that they removed the bottomless drinks for good now. It's frustrating when you find something awesome that is priced just rite and it gets removed for whatever reason yes we will be retuning but for now Lindos will not be our go to Sunday brunch location...when places take off the reason people go to their restaurant because they think it will save them money only hurts the restaurant in the long run.

ZtMQmGCYBIaC8czXaw4etg.text: We have been coming to Michoacan Gourmet Mexican Restaurant since it has opened.  We come several times a month because the food is the best ever.  We are travelers and we always try to find the best Mexican restaurant in whatever town we are visiting.  None of them come even close to what you can get at Michoacan.  The food there is absolutely superb!!!  The service is awesome (Josua, Javier, Luis, & Omar, just to name a few)!!!  The owners - Mark and Kyle regularly check if we are satisfied and happy with our meals and service.  We have brought numerous friends and relatives to this Centennial Center gem.  Everybody has always agreed with us that this is the best Mexican, hands down.  None of our dinner guests has ever been unhappy with what they ordered.  They also have the best Margaritas (thanks to Jose at the bar). The bacon wrapped shrimp are to die for. The table side guacamole is a must. Last year, I had my retirement party here with over 30 people.  The owners and the workers bent over backwards to make sure that I and my friends had a very good time.  If I could give this restaurant 10 stars, I would.

A5tNvjMAPa_pZ_TmzA2xvQ.text: I have been to the original location for many years and found it to be good however the centennial location is not the same. My daughter ordered a chicken dish and the chicken was over cooked and tough. Won't be coming back

Ih44NkdCKm9SE7h3hbS8NA.text: Ordered a Cadillac Margarita, worse ever. Luis took our order , and bring us our bill. nothing else, no follow up at all. you would think he would have asked about the Margarita since it wasn't touched. we just paid for it anyway, and left a less than $2 tip. can't remember ever doing that. avoid this place. we have dined here several times, and same crappy service, this will definitely be our last.

oy1t3NiseqJJ2vTf-uB-vg.text: I tried them out this past Sunday for the brunch buffet thing. I'm not a fan of buffets but I was craving Mexican but had no idea what kind so I figured buffet I would get a little of everything. I was very impressed with the dishes served and the presentation of it. The food was freshly made and was always being checked on and replaced. The 3 different kind of fajitas was my favorite and the eggs omelet station was also pretty good. I was made huevos rancheros right in front of my rather than scoop out of a tray. Great experience here. Staff was very attentive As well

Yc_V2tICviaHuSlS6BSl0w.text: Went to this location last night. Food was pretty bland. The salsa put on the table was tomato sauce from a can. The waiter came fairly quickly and asked what we wanted to drink. We told him and another gentleman brought them. The waiter took our order and another gentleman delivered the meal. Only time we saw the waiter again is when he brought the check. The meals were just ok. I decided to get a beef burrito and the beef was salty and really not cut small enough for a bite. A taco is basically the same wherever you go. We won't go back. I seriously hope the waiters there share their tips with the other people, because the waiter was non existent for the whole meal!

YJhB70E1MpO7JfUv2YNuZQ.text: Just had lunch with my hubby. We had the various street tacos and chocolate cake with vanila ice scream. Very food and good service. This could be one of our favorate go to place. Solidly good food.

JqcUdDGf_4EI9qa_KB8NDw.text: So this is the second time we have been to Michoacan in the last month and probably the 40th time over the last year.  We came in on Cinco de Mayo and it was just awful.  The salsa was watered down, Fideo soup had no noodles, and the fajitas were dry and lacked any flavor.  Additionally, we had a conversation going on between three people that verged on xrated and spoke of their sex life so that four tables away we could hear them with no issue, and I am no prude.  If I would have had my children I would have left the restaurant and never returned.  Our waiter Efren appeared to have no issue and proceeded to give lackluster service.  Fast forward 20 days to today and we again have the same waiter and we again are disappointed by the food and waiter.  We ordered two burritos and a combo and received no soup and my chile relleno was raw and not cooked.  It is with great sadness that i write this as we have come here for years.  I fortunately refer you now yo our alternate mexican restaurant Viva Mercado in Village Square or any if the numerous Cafe Rio Locations, which to this point have not altered the quality of their food.  I may not come back, I will not come back for Cinco, and i definitely will not refer anyone at this point as it is just disappointing. Quality Quality Quality.  The one positive in all of this was the kick ass work ethic by Phibbs bussing the tables.  Sorry Michoacan but now you are just one of the 100's of mediocre Mexican restaurants.  James Miller

V6od51ihhYtqoWITsCa4Ng.text: Great food as always! Carlos and Vidal served us tonight, and those guys kept the chips and the dips coming! Mark, promote these guys! You have a great team here: make sure you throw a good Cinco de Mayo party for the team and don't let your good people go! God bless you all and the hungry patrons you serve!  -Jake the film guy

wHffKYnNKCc5peqw8XBkTw.text: Best Mexican restaurant in Vegas, been going here since it opened.  Best customer service, even better at night time dining. Been traveling to many places and Lindo has the best salsa/ bean dip with chips.   Customer service is superb, we recently moved out of vegas to Alaska and come back to eat at this restaurant.

2hg01xd8mo6tilrkXTZbpg.text: We love the chips, beans, and salsa! The food has always been delicious. The staff has all been there for years, and they have great service.

FnnWE_zKqyOXZr9WZFpVEA.text: A delicious meal just like everytime we eat here. I'm not a burrito, taco, enchilada fan so I pass on the combo plates. I prefer the dinner plates where you choose the protein and then the sauce. There's about 5 sauces that I prefer and they never let me down. The staff are very good at matching the flavors between proteins and sauce. If I can't make up my mind,  then I go for the fajitas. Those are the best I've had in town.

Jln-jOYT3kLILZ4Xpnb2Tg.text: Love the home made guacamole here it's the best ever and amazing burritos! Definitely recommend!

7h7NxtNrQnwJXhbLHEU5Jw.text: Not bad!!!  I had tried this place years ago when we had a Vegan Eatz/V Animal Sanctuary dinner and.......I was not impressed.  Hubs and I were craving refried beans, some table side guac...the works.  The table side guac was yummy, I kinda wish I would have asked for more cilantro and some jalapenos (we were afraid it would be too spicy. But know we know.  Just speak up and ask for it exactly the way you want it.  Hubs got the vegan burritos they had grilled and sauteed veggies, beans with optional red sauce on top. It came with a side of refried beans. I tried it and it was very yum.  I wanted to FINALLY try a tamale. I'm not sure if I have really ever eaten a tamale? I'm not a fan of ground mushy maize. (It tastes like a wet dog smells to me for some reason.)  Well, this didn't. And it was vegan. It was full of mushrooms and garlic. You can choose either red or green sauce to go on top. It was yum. And big! One was filling to me. I got a side "salad" of tomatoes lettuce and onion with cilantro vinaigrette and it was too much food for me.  I really like their bean dip, salsa and chips! I can really put a hurtin' on them.  Keep in mind this is NOT health food and probably contains more oil than one should eat in a year total, but it's good Americanize Mex!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. cute mosaic light at the table
Photo of Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. hubs veggie burritos with refried on the side (vegan)
Photo of Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. up close of my gigantic &#34;side salad&#34; :D with yummy cilantro vinegar dressing on the side

ypYgu9o-kcxGlX1unD0WgQ.text: Really enjoyed an early dinner/happy hour here today. The top shelf margarita was super tasty and they offered some fun happy hour eats. Tried the queso fundito (not on the happy hour menu) and it was a very very very guilty pleasure! The peppers in it were to die for, smokey and sweet. I'll be back!

MVVdSVbgdc_DkWDSyAiKcg.text: Super amazing stuff and the food is truly amazing they are pretty funny for a birthday request love it love it love it can't wait to go back again

photos.caption: Photo of Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Mll0RlbKvsnwh1cCdxsUUQ.text: I just got back from a meal that my father and I are still talking about, and the talk is all good! The Mexican restaurant MICHOACAN at Tropical parkway and Centennial. The food, and the people that work there give a Great atmosphere to a very good dining experience. I was so pleased with how all the employees work together to make sure that not only weren't my dad and I left wanting, but from what I observed, neither were our fellow diners. Even though neither my dad and I ordered anything from the bar, I could see that a good number of people were enjoying themselves at the bar while enjoying the Golden Knights power on against Washington. If you want to enjoy a good meal and get stuffed--the portions are so much-- with or without drinks, my opinion, you will be greatly pleased with your outing at MICHOACAN...

E5v53Pb-8vRsSgjp_SMZ6A.text: Flies were in the resturant and bathroom. Waiter was so busy they forgot our food and my dish was cold. I won't be going back.

xaeky25fgkihmzQv7iTzRA.text: Jose Hernandez (the bartender) smells so good and is so hot, the reason I come to this restaurant is not food but to see Jose's beautiful smile and to hear funny jokes. OMG best bartender in town. I recommend This place!!!!!

W5h93VytuDL1DI75MoKceg.text: Honestly this was as bad as it gets. The restaurant was fairly crowded on a Saturday night, as to be expected. We placed a to-go order to avoid the rush and it was a total disaster. The hostess who took the order forgot to put it in the system until I arrived (30 minutes after I called to place the order to begin with). They said it would take 15 to 20 minutes to complete it. Because of the small space it was very congested and the manager wasn't helpful in the least, simply telling me he was sorry but there was nothing more he could do (what about a discount?). When we arrived home they forgot several items, gave us one wrong dish, and put them together poorly. On top of it all the food was incredibly mediocre. On the Border is a similar Mexican restaurant half a mile away. Save yourself the trouble and go there.

H4jzrjp_6qnVZ4WfRxFoBQ.text: Hands down the best tacos in the world! The service here is what makes me come back time and time again. Staff is like family and food is the better then grandmas. If you're not eating every meal here then you are a fool. Plus you can always watch a game at the bar. Ask for Luis, he'll take care of ya!

24rnklTftd4B68KibVBz3g.text: If it's possible to give someone zero reviews I totally would. I called ahead some sides, salsa, beans and guacamole. They told me 15 mins, and 40 mins later they give me my order. It's not busy at all, people coming and getting sat right away. DONT QUOTE SOMEONE 15 MIN WHEN ITS MORE THAN DOUBLE THE WAIT. I am more upset that they were sides that are ready except the guacamole... get your #%*+ together.

iEOXJNWZPSS-U8pGZL7qBQ.text: Had a great time at the bar today because of Jose, I felt like he was a personal friend that I had known forever.  He turned on the knights game for us to watch which was appreciated!  He knew exactly what I wanted and was very personable.  Will definitely return to sit at the bar!

zPdT9W7fqfT9uj-auNG2_Q.text: This place is our family night go to! Jose in the bar is fantastic. We usually get the enchiladas de camarones and they are delicious! Also, the chile relleno is the best I've ever had! Josue and the older busser, can't remember his name, are always super friendly! Thanks guys!

photos.caption: Photo of Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Refreshing paloma. Thanks, Jose... best bartender!

uZEqyZnhCFB3G1XyH89Ckw.text: Food was good as always! Fast service, food was and is always hot. Willing to make the food how you want.

pKMYy2HSYTwUvNkptr_PcQ.text: My wife and I have eaten here since it opened and it has never been on point.  It hasn't been our #1 Mexican restaurant in quite a while.  The consistency is not there.  The rewards program is one of the worst that exist.  It's almost insulting. Mexican food doesn't cost much to make and their pricing is on the high side.  We've traveled farther distances for much better quality at a more reasonable price.  Out of all the Michoacan restaurants, the one on D.I. & Eastern or Craig & I-15 are more consistent and not disappointing.

xSTRtYBDh_I6Jmg_fnb-qw.text: I had so much fun here at a recent Paws on the Patio event. The food was well prepared and came very promptly.  I totally enjoyed the chicken tacos   Thanks for having this event a great time was had by all

6NlBD1UayElyhJJAWyHXyA.text: Food:  Below average.  I tried the rib eye steak, lacked seasoning. My wife had the milanesa, it was crispy and slightly above average.  The fresh guacamole was also just average, not great.  The fried icecream was terrible. Nothing like stale soggy cornflakes to ruin good ice cream.  Service: Terrible. After sitting unattend for the first 6 minutes a server brought us chips, salsa, and their bean dip; he left before we could ask for drinks. Five minutes later someone came and took our drink order. About 20 minute in we got our drinks and ordered. They brought my steak without a steak knife and forgot my tortillas, but I didn't notice till the waiter stepped away. Since they were no were to be seen, I mushed through it with a butter knife.  Later in the meal they did refill our waters a few times.  As we were finishing up, they were very quick to clear away our plates.  Overall, the food is far from special.  The service was slow and unattentive. I would not recommend this place to a friend and I would never return.

f0p55NOb_OOlBpQVyAVp8A.text: This place rocks. Every location is fantastic and the staff is always kind and overwhelmingly accommodating. I come here with my 94 year old grandmother who has a walker - they make sure we are very comfortable. Good food always and they bring complimentary soup and refried beans with chips and salsa!

wRVrI2C8fPTyPCCjR0EO7w.text: AVOID this location at all costs! My wife and I always go to the location on Decatur and Twain. This time we decided to give this location a try and it was a huge mistake! It took 29 minutes (I timed it on my Fitbit) just for our server "Cesar" to get our order! We ended up not giving him a tip and the jerk actually followed us outside and asked us why! I thought that was very unprofessional. So if you want horrible service, than go eat here.

EJV2KlXQIASy64yDJVlDFg.text: One of my favorite Mexican restaurants ever. Wait time is 5 minutes or less, service is always attentive and friendly and fast, their margaritas on the rocks are always perfect just like their soup. Chips, guacamole, and Tacos al Pastor meal is very good.

WraYVAJXd3AhzbXqXTREkw.text: Went with my family on Saturday. We had a reservation for 6 at 6pm. We were seated right away in the back room. Which was great because we had my 3 year old and it was nice and secluded so we didn't have to worry if he was a little antsy since he missed his nap. The menu had a great variety. I was excited when I saw Squirt listed under the sodas. Ordered it. They did not have it. Decided to try a blueberry daiquiri since I saw it on the menu. The waiter came back to inform me they did not have it. For dinner ordered the skirt steak. Which is always one of my favorite cuts off meat in Mexican cuisine. Once AGAIN, the waiter came back and informed me they did not have it. I went with the NY strip instead, which was more expensive. My entire family was served their meal EXCEPT ME! Once I informed the waiter (food runners brought the meal out to my family ), it took almost 10 more minutes to get my food. What I did receive was delicious. But nothing was done or offered for the delay or that everything I ordered they were out of. Not even an offer to buy my dessert, as most places would. Our waiter was very sweet, but I feel the costumer service was lacking because of that. I think the extra kick in the pants is that my family wanted to go to another Mexican restaurant that evening, but I persuaded them to dine here and my experience was not that wonderful.

dKtv6ZbhRwwA7_QA9zaXqQ.text: I have been dining at this location weekly since November 2012. We went in one saturday night for dinner and were hooked on the atmosphere, the food, and the live mariachi band!  We go almost every week now and at the time of this review I seem to be "The Duke" of this location here on YELP because I check in every time we dine.  This place is really worth it all around. It is individually owned these days and the quality of everything is superb. Family friendly and always packed on Friday and Saturday nights at dinnertime. Call ahead and they will put your name on the wait list. You can also reserve a table on their web site.  The owner told me the entire interior design and all the items were hand selected from Mexico by himself and brought to the restaurant. It's a great atmosphere and the staff is friendly, quick, and knows how to serve hungry customers.  THE FOOD:  When you are seated you get chips, salsa, and bean dip. Always great!  All of their sauces are made by hand fresh daily. I think they have 7 of them.  We have tried, and LOVE the following dishes:  - Chicken Fajitas  - Carnitas (they serve them with a rib!)  - Chicken Enchiladas (with the green sauce) This one is my favorite. The flavors are delicate, the chicken is shredded and tasty and it has me hooked. I normally ask for a side of shredded lettuce and cheese instead of the usual rice and beans. It's just my preference.  They also have a awesome dessert that consists of a huge ball of fried ice cream surrounded by caramel sauce and sliced plantains (think bananas) that is lit on fire and served to you flaming! Soo good!  I have heard their Sunday Buffet Brunch is pretty awesome, but I normally go on Saturday nights for the LIVE mariachi band so I miss going on Sunday.  I signed up for their loyalty card the second time we went back. They put 5% of the total of your bill each time you dine on a gift card that you can just save up and use towards any meal. How awesome is that? I think I have close to $30 right now saved on it.  The price of the food is very fair for the quality you get. Portion size is more than enough. All in all I can't say anything negative about this place... and no, I wasn't paid to write this. HAHA.

etit-xCK87fH9Tt63XyAng.text: This is the worst place I have ever been to! I could of made better food in my house with the privilege of not dealing with horrible servers. Our server probably said two words the entire time, otherwise he would just stand there. Our drinks were not refilled. We were never asked how the food was, which was bad! I will not be coming back due to the service, food, and outrages prices.

LUGaMDRhvDvdc-epF3j1nw.text: when I'm craving a chelada, chips and salsa with some fideo soup prior to my meal I pick this place, great service and great food. you can see the ladies making tortillas  through a glass window like in old town san diego. I've tried just about everything on the menu and haven't found a flaw.

photos.caption: Photo of Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. refreshing!

EQ9Qz9a7JuA0I8VCpBI5rQ.text: The Best Mexican food in the area. Great place with a wonderful atmosphere. I love it here. Beautiful patio and a wonderful Sunday brunch. The food is fantastic!

D5CyUTf7uLV8jqYrnswP6g.text: Great service and not too pricey. The food is very authentic and the fried ice cream is to die for. The booths are bit of a tight squeeze but not crazy. Enviroment feels authentic and very homey. Will always go here as long as it is open!

HDseJS_O2zbvm9TKHHS-Bg.text: Today was Father's Day & my Mom's Birthday, so we decided to grab some lunch here.  Here's a tip.....if you want to come here on a holiday and you don't mind eating lunch early, stop by between 9:30-10:30 am.....it's open and there's no wait to get in.  If you come after 11 am, it will be jam packed.  I ordered the Nachos & Mom ordered the Playa Combo....which is a Chile Relleno & Chicken Taco.  The food came out quickly and of course everything was fresh and delicious.  I love how they have complimentary unlimited Chips & Salsa w/Beans.  The Salsa is spicy, just right and the Chips are homemade.  This place never disappoints!  Happy Father's Day to all the Dad's out there!  Voy a volver? Por supuesto!  (Will I return?  Of course!)

n3s_UrIGHdez6Hk-g4djzw.text: This was my first time here. Check in and get 3 free churros!  I got the pork burrito, asked for no pick but they gave it to me anyway, dinged them a star for not doing "special" requests such as no onions or no pico. Very friendly and prompt staff, my drink glass was never empty. I found the food to be a little dull, I like spicy food and this had zero heat. The burrito was as big as my head! Portions are very large.

DDIS1jRQiyFu9EzKIpr5sQ.text: This is a favorite stop when we visit family in Las Vegas. The food is authentic Mexican cuisine. The fideo soup is a perfect start to a nice dinner that makes you feel right at home. The only issue we have had is the portions are very large. We ordered Ala carte this time which was perfect. We got the two fideo soups, a taco, an enchilada, and guacamole.  With the chips and salsa along with two margaritas we were totally satisfied.   The food, service, and atmosphere make this one of our favorite Resturant's in Las Vegas.

IPgO0J9SZPwlKMCRW2yGZg.text: We love this place!  It is good food great service. My wife and we're in the mood for Mexican food and we always pick this place! Thank you again for a great meal!

ZwZYAaSRp5KmsrVhvsIRyA.text: I love eating here! They customize my order with no problem.  I like the "Shredded Chicken Burrito" with beans inside the burrito and it has so much flavor! The salsa is tasty and if you request it they will bake and not fry your chips. I usually call ahead if I know I am going to be there and they get them started for me. This last visit the place was packed. They have live music that is cool. It is clean inside. I think if you are in the area you should give it a try! There us currently a weekend lunch buffet that is a great deal.  I like that it is near the super wal-mart because since most of my paycheck goes to wally world I can at least stop by Lindo on the way and have lunch or dinner :)

ylOCywh8DmUMkJBQSkyCAw.text: I love this place I love their chips and salsa and fajitas and bean dip yummy. The wait staff is the best And so is the owner he is great for Happy hour Margaritas are the best......

4PJV5o9YAPaQrJ-J3Sg8LA.text: My mom and I went there for happy hour. We ordered the tableside guacamole.  It was ok. Nothing special. When we received our bill, they not only tried to charge us full price for our drinks, they tried to charge us for premium liquors we never ordered. We had to call a manager over to fix it. They tried to overcharge us by $30. I will never go back here.

Jim747OY6cugADFqAe4x4Q.text: Nothing in my meal really stood out.  The carnitas were tender, but had absolutely no flavor and that seemed to be the theme of my meal.  Everything was rather bland and unexciting.  Service was fine, in that chain-restaurant-I'm-reading-from-a-script sort of way. I had been told good things about these restaurants with some people claiming it was quite authentic.  When it comes to Mexican food, I have equal love for authentic and full-on cheese sauce covered American, as long as it's done well.  This wasn't either.

5cxtCyyWwqKZQ2v8XtrgKg.text: This place is not worth your time and money. Second visit to this restaurant, first was when they first opened. Friday nite visit, restaurant was crowded, Marachi music being played. Seated quickly, drink order filled promptly and chips, salas,beans brought. Ordered a Chopped salad and chicken fajitias. Plates served hot, but items beans/rice were cold. Rice was tasteless and hard, Beans cold a bit sour, which leads me believe they weren't fresh. This restaurnt is way over-priced for what you get, you;d do much better at some local mexican restaturants close by. Won't be back ever again...

hHz5mD06MjjlIBXeQh0rRQ.text: Decent food, decent prices, and excellent service and ambiance.  I got the vegetarian enchiladas which came with the entree, tortilla chips, beans and rice, little corn flour tortilas, fideo soup, and what was either a spicy sauce or salsa (not too experienced with Mexican food, so I couldn't tell if they forgot to give me salsa or if that was it).    The fideo soup was really good, kind of like a Mexican version of ramen noodles (I mean the real Asian kind, not the stuff college students eat).  I thought the amount of food was good for the price I paid.  I filled up so much on the rice and bean tortillas that I didn't finish the entree in one sitting.   The only complaint I have was the veggies in the veggie enchilada could have been more diverse.  It was mostly carrots and squash.  I would have liked to see some more cheese in it also.    They didn't wow me, but I would come back when I'm in the mood for Mexican.

mqGngb0kHl0EPMd3CD79IQ.text: I really liked the food. Very authentic too. I am obsessed with the appetizer "Gorditas de Camarones". OMGGGGG So fried burrittos filled with shrimp and cheese and sour cream. MMMM YeSSSS. Very friendly service and great happy hour prices.

f0HYXy3Mpveu6GbASAOciw.text: i've had the cognac chicken, fajitas and enchiladas here. it's not completely authentic, which I think is a good things... or, rather, this pace is more new-age Mexican fusion than your nina's Mexican cooking w/ ingredients they use in their specialties.  The (fresh) tortillas are amazing and-my favorite quality of this joint-the food is always perfectly balance in portions. You'll never leave with puddles of extra-whatever on your plate staring up at you, all alone! Dinner usually runs $15-20ish, sans drinks. Only good mexican i've tasted in vegas.

QyOghbTozg3UwVDT4w8ifQ.text: we have only been here for lunch times, but it has always been delicious, gr8 happy hr specials....good atmosphere, good food, nice staff

rB84bHNFWAIo5KoCY4kw3g.text: I'm here at least twice a month for business lunches. Great atmosphere and the food is excellent. Pollo con rajas y crema, insane!

1oq2dicLMFvq-SYSMgHsRA.text: It's okay but I would recommend the real deal - their sister restaurant - Viva Zapata's near Craig and I-15. It really is much better. LM is okay - but not even close to the quality at VZ.

FEnKN-gOK73DUmbHA19oXQ.text: The first location on D.I. was my husband and my favorite Mexican Restaurant.  We would drive down from the Mount Charleston/Centennial Hills area.  We tried this location once and really missed the atmosphere of the other location.  However, in March while on a 14-day Caribbean Princess Cruise we met two of our neighbors on the ship.  When speaking of Mexican food, they highly suggested a new place closer to home called Leticia's.  And we've been hooked ever since. GREAT home cooked food, friendly warm staff, great atmosphere in a quaint location.

Jq5rDtXGV8sdmjd6GM9Gkg.text: just really disappointing. chips are horrible (couldnt eat them) the entrees were barely average. the margaritas tasted like a bottled mix. and the service was super slow. yeah ill give 1 pity star to you

7t7EeHo5T7KXbn5RpN6piw.text: I had the opportunity to go to this amazing restaurant. My friend ordered me this platter with shrimp that was so delicious I can't wait to go back just to savor the flavor. It has special herbs in oil the flavor was unforgettable. The tortillas are hand made in a window in front of us. To top it off I had a deep fried ice-cream; a ball of white ice cream covered with crushed flakes cereal, flavored syrup on the bottom with liquor and bananas on FIRE!!! It was soooooo good. Clean and unforgettable. Why isn't their one around here?

GwvvAPzqXehhY4660R0cFg.text: I realize now that I've never had great Mexican food after eating here.  this restaurant is outstanding! Great food and excellent service. We ate here two nights in a rowland didn't scratch the menu's surface. bar available and take out. If you want excellent Mexcian food and not Americanized crap, eat here. It is my new fave!

KhBFNeYFidoIDc_LLHh49g.text: The service and the food were outstanding.  The carnitas were excellent!  Our birthday celebration was fun with singing, dessert and a shot of tequila!  We will definitely be going back!

ZPEiNPMGZS_QbsMoTkAhFQ.text: Love this place!! Been going to this chain for 15 years. Been going to this location since they opened. I always request Jesus as my server. Best server ever. Attention to detail makes the experience that much better.

u0yd5lXhYUxw3Cu5c-m7hQ.text: I've been here twice now and can't say I'm blown away.  It's expensive and not up to expectations.  I will say the service is outstanding, I mean they are seriously on it.  I use to live in LA so I know some good mexican and this place doesn't quite cut it.  I probably won't be going back.  Very AVERAGE in my opinion.

Fmus9hQoMXtIMrKUQTtGxQ.text: As good as it gets in Vegas as far as authentic Mexican food. Unless you go to SoCal and go to a little taqueria, you won't get better Mexican food! I've had the chiles relleno, carne asada, several different carnitas and steak type dishes and they are all top notch. Good prices for a nice sit down type restaurant. Me and the wife usually both eat for around $40, tip included. The Don Fransisco is my favorite dish, it's a nice size piece of carne asada smothered in melted queso, chiles, and cebollas...YUM! Also the atmosphere is awesome with live marriachi/rancheras music! The service is also top notch, and the waiters are very helpful and knowledgeable about the menu! And as any person who knows comida Mexicana will tell you...try the salsa and the frijoles first...if they are good, then so will the food be. And they are both AWESOME here! 5 STARS all the way! Been here at least 10times, and will continue to go back about once a month or so till I leave Vegas in December!

R6AbZ_xFu5H-v6-SviHPNA.text: They have excellent food. Very few Mexican restaurants serve Sol and they have it. I would highly recommend them if you in the mood for Mexican.

GUG4jLpMzs8PpcicMEXcvw.text: I always get GREAT service and good food here.   Plus you can't beat the price.   I haven't had a drink here so I can't rate the bar.

e4su-NoPvUPPe88QqGrPZw.text: The food is excellent and the service is perhaps the best I have gotten anywhere. The wait staff is very attentive. When I finished my first glass of tea, the glass barely hit the table before someone was picking it up to refill. Same thing when the check was brought to the table.

cPGA875Bz0qJp2lE7d8cDg.text: as a recent resident of Las Vegas it was imperitive that i find an amazing mexican joint.. Lindo is legit.. great salsas, great service.. legit food.. however they charge what you would expect to see on the strip.. if the food were a bit cheaper i would give this place 4 or 5 stars..

apYcFw1RSgAHjkWDawrB2A.text: Fast service great tacos yummy. This place has been here for awhile but I have only recently stumbled onto it. I  have only had steak tacos and nachos so far but it's been great

efNYjYATfpdm6FNvEWkfUw.text: Came for lunch from out of town and everything was amazing! Our server Luis did a great job and all were very attentive! Is was great to have a great meal and get together with family! Thank u Luis!

dSKfrBVIVI3buuH6wPKMzA.text: Excellent customer service and great food. Their chips and salsa are excellent! Shrimp ceviche is super fresh and they have awesome street tacos. Perfect family spot; my dad and I visit frequently.   Psst.. they sale tamales by the dozen and they are delicious!

lZSRIy8wePvjMcYrsbPsvw.text: Decided to try this place out for dinner. I'd say it's your pretty standard Mexican food. Started with chips, salsa, and refried beans. I wasn't expecting the Fideos Soup as a complimentary starter with the chips & salsa; a nice change of pace. Although it's easy, don't get too full off of all this. A large party next to me barely ate 1/2 their food and they were all (happily) complaining about how full they were. They all left with to-go boxes. I had the Huachinango (whole fried snapper) with the garlic butter sauce on top. The fish was tasty with flaky flesh and crispy skin. The garlic butter sauce offered good flavor, but was primarily HUGE chunks of garlic. So large, I initially they were diced onions on top. Would've preferred a more blended sauce that would stick to the fish better. I like garlic...a lot. But that could be off-putting to some (see my pics of the fish). Finished the meal off with Churros **thanks Yelp check-in** You can't go wrong with a churro. It's drizzled with a caramel sauce and has whipped cream on the side. NO COMPLAINTS! All in all, a decent Mexican spot. Exactly what you'd expect, and I doubt anyone would be too disappointed with their food choices.  I would come here again: 1) I saw 1800 Tequilla Anejo behind the bar and I never find that at restaurants **my fave** 2) I'd like to try the Sunday Brunch Buffet

Is9PmsbIRu16nSrVzjHwsg.text: We're new to the area and tried this restaurant since everyone said it was really good, it wasn't. The drinks were strong but ither than that it wasn't what I hoped for. I had the chilaquiles and the chips were the greasiest I've ever had, they tasted like nothing but oil. The service was ok too. Overall not great.

9N0tHk0C9nuq8pBYgB9PUg.text: Waited for a table for 5 people for almost 30 mins. Everyone else that walked in with the same amount of people or less got seated right away but not us. Idk if we were Mexican but everyone that walked in that was white got seated with no wait time if they had kids and just showed up they got seated before us. No explanation was given nor was an update given. This was highly recommended for me to try and that just shut me down that there is no rules for first come. If your white you get seated if your Mexican wait till we think we're ready.

HojJWN68O289lUEa2aj1JQ.text: Amazing service and food!  The food is plentiful and enough for 2 people.  They give complimentary chips, salsa and bean dip.  I would recommend you checking them out!

oq-MrJRhCaLTeBvcXR4p4w.text: Never had a bad meal here. Lots of food choices, drinks, chips and dips at every table. Usually very fast service, get a reservation or plan on waiting. Prices are $10-25, margaritas $5-9. My favorite mex restaurant.

HiNPFj_n25i_oG5EH9R8Uw.text: Tableside Guac is the best! fast and friendly service, it's a smaller place but that doesn't stop the team there from delivering quality food in a short amount of time. Refilled drinks a handful of times without asking which was awesome- always nice to not be interrupted in a conversation. the prices are unbeatable but they also have some "fancier" meals that can get pricey if you'd like that instead. So happy to have found this place!

2B3uNr_i6GfYPeGzZ5Rn5g.text: Pleasantly surprised   Good food, attentive service and nice ambience.   This place is a small version of the bigger Lindo Michoacan.  They offer very good typical Mexican dishes with fresh made to order flour and corn tortillas (can't beat that!).    They have a nice selection of tequilas and other bar favorites.    Will definitely be going back

rnQMQdIWWRMGg2AT8yfByw.text: The service here is outstanding. Everyone was pleasant, friendly and on top of things. Drink refills were quick and fast. The margaritas on the rocks are delicious.   The food was fantastic, the shredded beef in the tacos are moist and flavorful. The garlic chicken was yummy and well worth ordering.  The facilities are clean and decorated very cute and fitting if you were visiting Mexico!!  Carlos was our waiter, he was phenomenal. English isn't his first language but he literally was one of the best waiters we have had around in the area.

Ygi7-vExVJI-uKTn5ILhiA.text: Bomb harina homemade tortillas, delicious chips with salsa & beans, nopales skillet, fresh guacamole, and sopes. Love this place! Nice ambiance by bar

EBrrzvPteJtqkZBpb23rQg.text: March 07,2019   I come here often and I usually get great customer service but today coming in here was a mistake the service we horrible waited about 30mim just to get my check at the end ! Not once was I checked to see if I needed anything

f0lYXvLk9sibTbyGe5XjxQ.text: This place is wonderful. I have been here several times and have set in the bar and the restaurant sides. The staff is wonderful. Very fast service and the prices are great.  Still haven't had a meal I didn't like.  Best Fish tacos in town.  The Bartenders are super friendly and make a great margarita.  Can't say enough about the service and food.  I guess that's why it's my first choice for Mexican cuisine.

kwNLCGmw2MBv1eVFAjAtTg.text: This place is decent. It's not bad but the food quality can be inconsistent which I don't care for.  I've been a couple of times and the food was good, but other times it's seemed as if they didn't season the food enough. Although, I will say the beans have been bland at best every time. It's unfortunate it's just not one of their strong suits.   The tamales were good one visit and just average the next, I don't know maybe they have a different cook like one named Roberto who is amazing and when he's in the kitchen the food is good, but when Fred is in the kitchen just accept the fact you're getting bland, sloppy, uneventful food.   Overall, I'm disappointed because I think Mexican food is my favorite genre and they're not living up to their full potential due to inconsistencies.

sw7LLBlfutzXCgIeBc9saA.text: Once again I am totally excited about this place.  Luis and Vidal provided outstanding service and attention to detail in giving us a most excellent meal and making sure our visit was beyond expection.  Thanks to both of you.

jHRHHi4BWkxpfI21DoSYkg.text: Service is amazing, food is tasty, good location, good for family reunion, price is good for food portions.

kPiOOoPN3m082iQCPy2nxA.text: This is the closest Mexican restaurant near us. It is just ok, some things are good, it is extremely overpriced for what you get. The 18$ chicken enchiladas are basically boiled shredded chicken ( not really seasoned) wrapped in some corn tortillas with some sauce over the top. Service is always ok, they are never very friendly for some reason. I just am not sure if it is worth the price anymore, and we have been here multiple times and I always forget how expensive it is for the mediocre food.

A_gFwme9nYFhXG5xHdS-Og.text: Been coming here for years! Really good. All time favorite is the posole!!! Make sure to get the "Jumbo Double Shot" margarita!!! Delish!!! As always we will be back!!

idSvZimFuC1zVet1RgH_pQ.text: Amazing little spot for sure. Love the decor, it looks like little Mexico in there.  We had a delicious chelada and bloody mary. I gotta say i have never had a hard time drinking a bloody mary before until today. Not because it wasn't good.. It was Great!! i loved that u could actually taste the vodka!!  They gave us fruit with a yummy strawberry mouse to start instead of the usual chips and salsa. I had the menudo and my husband had the chilaquiles. Both were delicious and served quick! We were also able to take advantage of the free churro dessert by checking in through yelp. The service was amazing!!! They checked on you often and everyone was very polite.  I am happy we found another great spot for mexican food.
